result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Malak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 9/30/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; Huber privileges. Court has no objection to  electronic monitoring. Report by 4/6/2015 by 2pm.  Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Malak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DENYING THE DEFENDANT'S MOTION OR REQUEST FOR RELEASE PRIVILEGES/ADDITIONAL RELEASE PRIVILEGES, signed and filed. lms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. crt
Requesting to attend daughter's graduation and Sister's wedding.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence; Huber privileges. Court has no objection to  electronic monitoring. Report by 4/6/2015 by 2pm.  Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 9/30/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Ineligile Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a pending charge. Defendant needs to meet with case manager today after court.  Defendant has made a payment towards assessment, and still needs to complete community servie. Review hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has tested positive for drugs and alcohol, picked up an new OWI charge and needs to complete community service.  Defendant has an Intake appointment scheduled and has begun attedning group sessions.    With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has made all appointments, tested negative, paid assessment fee and is employed.  Defendant needs to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for 09-16-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E Thomey.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E Thomey.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for  Patricia I Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Richard E Thomey.  William Levins for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON 5-15-2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven A Malak in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-14-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
